Data.Name: AddStringFieldDesc
Data.Value: Create a new string field for the current entry.

Data.Name: AttachedExistsAlready
Data.Value: The following file has already been attached to the current entry:

Data.Name: AttachExtDiscardDesc
Data.Value: Discard any changes made to the temporary file and do not modify the current attachment.

Data.Name: AttachExtImportDesc
Data.Value: Replace the attachment by the (modified) temporary file.

Data.Name: AttachExtOpened
Data.Value: KeePass has extracted the attachment to a (EFS-encrypted) temporary file and opened it using an external application.

Data.Name: AttachExtOpenedPost
Data.Value: After viewing/editing and closing the file in the external application, please choose how to continue

Data.Name: AttachExtSecDel
Data.Value: In any case, KeePass will securely delete the temporary file afterwards.

Data.Name: AttachNewRename
Data.Value: Do you wish to rename the new file or overwrite the existing attached file?

Data.Name: AttachNewRenameRemarks0
Data.Value: Click [Yes] to rename the new file.

Data.Name: AttachNewRenameRemarks1
Data.Value: Click [No] to overwrite the existing attached file.

Data.Name: AutoGeneratedPasswordSettings
Data.Value: Automatically generated passwords for new entries

Data.Name: AutoRememberOpenLastFile
Data.Value: Remember and automatically open last used database on startup

Data.Name: AutoSaveAfterEntryEdit
Data.Value: Automatically save after modifying an entry using the entry editing dialog

Data.Name: AutoSaveAtExit
Data.Value: Automatically save when closing/locking the database

Data.Name: AutoShowSoonToExpireEntries
Data.Value: Show entries that will expire soon (if any)

Data.Name: AutoSortDeactivateQ
Data.Value: Do you want to deactivate automatic sorting?

Data.Name: AutoSortNoRearrange
Data.Value: Entries currently cannot be rearranged, because automatic sorting is activated.

Data.Name: AutoTypeAbortedOnWindow
Data.Value: Auto-Type has been aborted, because the target window is disallowed by the application policy (defined by your administrator).

Data.Name: AutoTypeAlwaysShowSelDialog
Data.Value: Always show global auto-type entry selection dialog

Data.Name: AutoTypeCancelOnTitleChange
Data.Value: Cancel auto-type when the target window title changes

Data.Name: AutoTypeCancelOnWindowChange
Data.Value: Cancel auto-type when the target window changes

Data.Name: AutoTypeEntrySelectionDescLong2
Data.Value: The following entries have been found for the currently active target window. Please select the entry that you want to auto-type into the target window.

Data.Name: AutoTypeEntrySelectionDescShort
Data.Value: Multiple entries exist for the current window.

Data.Name: AutoTypeGlobalHint
Data.Value: If you want KeePass to search the active database for a matching entry and auto-type it, use the 'Global auto-type' hot key.

Data.Name: AutoTypeMatchByTagInTitle
Data.Value: An entry matches if one of its tags is contained in the target window title

Data.Name: AutoTypeMatchByTitle
Data.Value: An entry matches if its title is contained in the target window title

Data.Name: AutoTypeMatchByUrlHostInTitle
Data.Value: An entry matches if the host component of its URL is contained in the target window title

Data.Name: AutoTypeMatchByUrlInTitle
Data.Value: An entry matches if its URL is contained in the target window title

Data.Name: AutoTypeObfuscationHint
Data.Value: Auto-Type obfuscation may not work with all windows.

Data.Name: AutoTypePrependInitSeqForIE
Data.Value: Prepend special initialization sequence for Internet Explorer windows

Data.Name: AutoTypeReleaseAltWithKeyPress
Data.Value: Send Alt keypress when only the Alt modifier is active

Data.Name: AutoTypeSelectedNoEntry
Data.Value: To use the 'Auto-type selected entry' hot key, you first need to select an entry in KeePass.

Data.Name: AutoTypeSequenceInvalid
Data.Value: The specified auto-type sequence is invalid.

Data.Name: AutoTypeUnknownPlaceholder
Data.Value: The following auto-type placeholder or special key code is unknown/unsupported:

Data.Name: AutoTypeXDoToolRequired
Data.Value: The 'xdotool' utility/package is required for auto-type.

Data.Name: AutoTypeXDoToolRequiredGlobalVer
Data.Value: For global auto-type, the 'xdotool' utility/package is required (version 2.20100818.3004 or higher!).

Data.Name: BackupDatabase
Data.Value: You should regularly create a backup of the database file (onto an independent data storage device).

Data.Name: BackupFile
Data.Value: You should create a backup of this file.

Data.Name: CannotMoveEntriesBcsGroup
Data.Value: Cannot move entries because they are not stored in the same group.

Data.Name: CheckForUpdAtStart
Data.Value: Check for update at KeePass startup

Data.Name: ClearKeyCmdLineParams
Data.Value: Clear master key command line parameters after using them once

Data.Name: ClipboardClearDesc
Data.Value: Copying sensitive data to the clipboard starts a countdown. After the specified time, the clipboard is cleared.

Data.Name: ClipboardClearInSeconds
Data.Value: Clipboard will be cleared in [PARAM] seconds

Data.Name: ClipboardNoPersist
Data.Value: Do not store data in the Windows clipboard history and the cloud clipboard

Data.Name: ClipboardOptionME
Data.Value: This option applies to entry clipboard commands in the main window (like 'Copy User Name' and 'Copy Password').

Data.Name: CloseButtonMinimizes
Data.Value: Close button [X] minimizes main window instead of terminating the application

Data.Name: ClusterCentersDesc
Data.Value: Each entry in the list below is the center of a cluster of entries that have similar, but not identical passwords. Click on an entry to see the cluster (list of entries with descending similarity).

Data.Name: ConfigAffectAdmin
Data.Value: Changes to the configuration/policy will affect you and all users of this KeePass installation.

Data.Name: ConfigAffectUser
Data.Value: Changes to the configuration/policy will only affect you. Policy flags that are enforced by the administrator are reset after restarting KeePass.

Data.Name: ConfigOverwriteBackup
Data.Value: KeePass will maybe overwrite the configuration file. Therefore, a backup has been created.

Data.Name: ConfigureAutoTypeDesc
Data.Value: Configure auto-type behaviour for this entry.

Data.Name: ConfigureAutoTypeItemDesc
Data.Value: Associate a window title with a keystroke sequence.

Data.Name: CopyInitialPasswordDesc
Data.Value: Copy the password that was current when the dialog was opened

Data.Name: CopyUrlsInsteadOfOpening
Data.Value: Copy URLs to clipboard instead of opening them

Data.Name: CorruptionByExt
Data.Value: Such a corruption is usually caused by a plugin or a KeePass port. Please try to find out which plugin/port is causing it and report the issue to the corresponding developer.

Data.Name: CredSaveNone
Data.Value: Do not remember user name and password

Data.Name: CsprojCountError
Data.Value: There must be exactly one .csproj or .vbproj file.

Data.Name: CsvImportDesc
Data.Value: Import data from a file containing comma-separated values (CSV).

Data.Name: CtrlAltAConflict
Data.Value: KeePass' global auto-type hot key Ctrl+Alt+A is in conflict with a system key combination that is producing '{PARAM}'.

Data.Name: CtrlAltAConflictHint
Data.Value: You can change the global auto-type hot key to a different key combination in 'Tools' -> 'Options' -> tab 'Integration'.

Data.Name: DatabaseDescPrompt
Data.Value: Enter a short description of the database or leave it empty.

Data.Name: DatabaseFileIntro
Data.Value: Your data will be stored in a KeePass database file, which is a regular file. After clicking [OK], you will be prompted to specify the location where KeePass should save this file.

Data.Name: DatabaseFileRem
Data.Value: It is important that you remember where the database file is stored.

Data.Name: DatabaseMaintenanceDesc
Data.Value: Here you can maintain the currently open database.

Data.Name: DatabaseModifiedNoDot
Data.Value: The current database file has been modified

Data.Name: DatabaseNamePrompt
Data.Value: Enter a name for the database or leave it empty.

Data.Name: DatabaseOpenUnknownVersionAsk
Data.Value: Show confirmation dialog when opening a database file whose minor format version is unknown

Data.Name: DatabaseOpenUnknownVersionInfo
Data.Value: The format version of the selected database file is higher than the one supported by the currently running KeePass instance. Most likely, the database file has been created by a newer KeePass version. KeePass can try to open the database file, but certain data may be lost.

Data.Name: DatabaseOpenUnknownVersionQ
Data.Value: Do you want to try opening the database file, possibly losing certain data?

Data.Name: DatabaseOpenUnknownVersionRec
Data.Value: In order to avoid data loss, it is recommended to install/use the latest version of KeePass.

Data.Name: DatabaseSettingsDesc
Data.Value: Here you can configure various database settings.

Data.Name: DataLoss
Data.Value: If you lose the database file or any of the master key components (or forget the composition), all data stored in the database is lost. KeePass does not have any built-in file backup functionality. There is no backdoor and no universal key that can open your database.

Data.Name: DbMntncResults
Data.Value: Show results of database maintenance in a dialog

Data.Name: DeleteEntriesQuestion
Data.Value: Are you sure you want to permanently delete the selected entries?

Data.Name: DeleteEntriesQuestionSingle
Data.Value: Are you sure you want to permanently delete the selected entry?

Data.Name: DeleteGroupInfo
Data.Value: Deleting a group will also delete all entries and subgroups in that group.

Data.Name: DeleteGroupQuestion
Data.Value: Are you sure you want to permanently delete the selected group?

Data.Name: DialogNoShowAgain
Data.Value: Do not show this dialog again.

Data.Name: DisableSaveIfNotModified
Data.Value: Disable 'Save' command (instead of graying it out) if the database hasn't been modified

Data.Name: DocumentationHint
Data.Value: Please see the documentation for more details.

Data.Name: DropToBackOnCopy
Data.Value: Drop to background after copying data to the clipboard

Data.Name: DuplicatePasswordsList
Data.Value: List of entries that are using the same passwords.

Data.Name: DuplicatePasswordsNone
Data.Value: No duplicate passwords have been found.

Data.Name: DuplicateStringFieldName
Data.Value: The string field name you specified already exists. String field names must be unique for each entry.

Data.Name: EditGroupDesc
Data.Value: Edit properties of the currently selected group.

Data.Name: EditStringFieldDesc
Data.Value: Edit one of the entry's string fields.

Data.Name: EmergencySheetAsk
Data.Value: Ask whether to create an emergency sheet

Data.Name: EmergencySheetInfo
Data.Value: A KeePass emergency sheet contains all important information that is required to open your database. It should be printed, filled out and stored in a secure location, where only you and possibly a few other people that you trust have access to.

Data.Name: EmergencySheetPrintInfo
Data.Value: KeePass will print an emergency sheet, which you can then fill out.

Data.Name: EmergencySheetQ
Data.Value: Do you want to print an emergency sheet now?

Data.Name: EmergencySheetRec
Data.Value: It is recommended that you create an emergency sheet for your database.

Data.Name: EmptyMasterPw
Data.Value: You have selected to use an empty master password.

Data.Name: EmptyMasterPwHint
Data.Value: An empty master password is not the same as using no master password at all.

Data.Name: EmptyMasterPwQuestion
Data.Value: Are you sure you want to use an empty master password?

Data.Name: EmptyRecycleBinQuestion
Data.Value: Are you sure you want to permanently delete the items?

Data.Name: EncodingFail
Data.Value: Selected encoding is invalid. The file cannot be interpreted using the selected encoding.

Data.Name: EntryListAutoResizeColumns
Data.Value: Automatically resize entry list columns when resizing the main window

Data.Name: EntrySelGroupSel
Data.Value: When selecting an entry, automatically select its parent group, too

Data.Name: ExitInsteadOfLockingAfterTime
Data.Value: Exit instead of locking the workspace after the specified time

Data.Name: ExitInsteadOfLockingAlways
Data.Value: Always exit instead of locking the workspace

Data.Name: ExportFileDesc
Data.Value: Export data to an external file.

Data.Name: ExportHtmlDesc
Data.Value: Export entries to a HTML file.

Data.Name: FieldNameExistsAlready
Data.Value: The entered name exists already and cannot be used.

Data.Name: FieldNameInvalid
Data.Value: The entered name is invalid and cannot be used.

Data.Name: FieldRefInvalidChars
Data.Value: The selected field, which identifies the source entry, contains illegal characters (like '{', '}', newline characters, ...).

Data.Name: FieldRefMultiMatch
Data.Value: Multiple entries match the specified identifying field.

Data.Name: FieldRefMultiMatchHint
Data.Value: To avoid ambiguity, entries can be identified by their UUIDs, which are unique.

Data.Name: FileChanged
Data.Value: The file on disk/server has changed since it was loaded. Probably someone else has edited and saved the database.

Data.Name: FileChangedOverwrite
Data.Value: Save the current database to the file. Changes made by the other user will be lost.

Data.Name: FileChangedSync
Data.Value: Load the file on disk/server and merge it with the current database in memory.

Data.Name: FileExtInstallFailed
Data.Value: Failed to create the file association. Make sure you have write access to the file associations list.

Data.Name: FileExtInstallSuccess
Data.Value: Successfully associated KDBX files with KeePass! KDBX files will now be opened by KeePass when you double-click on them.

Data.Name: FileImportFailed
Data.Value: Failed to import the specified file!

Data.Name: FileNameContainsSemicolonError
Data.Value: This file path contains a semicolon (;) and therefore cannot be processed. Replace the semicolon and repeat the procedure.

Data.Name: FileNotFoundError
Data.Value: The specified file could not be found.

Data.Name: FilePathFullReq
Data.Value: Please specify the full path to the file.

Data.Name: FileSaveQ
Data.Value: Do you want to save the database now?

Data.Name: FileSaveQClosing
Data.Value: Save database changes before closing the file?

Data.Name: FileSaveQExiting
Data.Value: Save database changes before exiting KeePass?

Data.Name: FileSaveQLocking
Data.Value: Save database changes before locking the workspace?

Data.Name: FileSaveQOpCancelClosing
Data.Value: The file will not be closed.

Data.Name: FileSaveQOpCancelLocking
Data.Value: The KeePass workspace will not be locked.

Data.Name: FileSaveQOpNoClosing
Data.Value: Discard all changes made to the database and close the file.

Data.Name: FileSaveQOpNoExiting
Data.Value: Discard all changes made to the database and exit KeePass.

Data.Name: FileSaveQOpNoLocking
Data.Value: Discard all changes made to the database and lock the KeePass workspace.

Data.Name: FileSaveQOpYesClosing
Data.Value: Save all changes made to the database and close the file.

Data.Name: FileSaveQOpYesExiting
Data.Value: Save all changes made to the database and exit KeePass.

Data.Name: FileSaveQOpYesLocking
Data.Value: Save all changes made to the database and lock the KeePass workspace.

Data.Name: FileSearchModes
Data.Value: There are two search modes: quick and normal.

Data.Name: FileSearchNormalDesc
Data.Value: A normal search finds all files (by looking at file contents), but requires a lot more time than a quick search.

Data.Name: FileSearchQuickDesc
Data.Value: In a quick search, KeePass only considers files that have one of the usual file name extensions. This is fast, but may not find all files.

Data.Name: FileVerifyHashFail
Data.Value: The new file's content does not match the data that KeePass has written, i.e. writing to the file has failed and it might be corrupted now.

Data.Name: FileVerifyHashFailRec
Data.Value: Please try saving again, and if that fails, save the database to a different location.

Data.Name: FixByReinstall
Data.Value: In order to fix this problem, it is recommended to reinstall KeePass.

Data.Name: FocusQuickFindOnRestore
Data.Value: Focus quick search box when restoring from taskbar

Data.Name: FocusQuickFindOnUntray
Data.Value: Focus quick search box when restoring from tray

Data.Name: FocusResultsAfterQuickSearch
Data.Value: Focus entry list after a successful quick search

Data.Name: ForceSystemFontUnix
Data.Value: Force usage of system font (Unix only)

Data.Name: FormatNoDatabaseDesc
Data.Value: This file format doesn't support database descriptions.

Data.Name: FormatNoDatabaseName
Data.Value: This file format doesn't support database names.

Data.Name: FormatNoRootEntries
Data.Value: This file format doesn't support root groups. All entries in the root group are moved to the first subgroup.

Data.Name: FormatNoSubGroupsInRoot
Data.Value: To export to this file format, the root group must have at least one subgroup.

Data.Name: FormatOnlyOneAttachment
Data.Value: This file format only supports one attachment per entry. Only the first attachment is saved, the others are ignored.

Data.Name: GenerateCountDesc
Data.Value: Enter number of passwords to generate.

Data.Name: GenerateCountLongDesc
Data.Value: Please enter the number of passwords to generate:

Data.Name: GenPwSprVariant
Data.Value: The generated password contains a placeholder. When using this password (e.g. by copying it to the clipboard or auto-typing it), the placeholder will be replaced, i.e. effectively a different password might be used.

Data.Name: GroupCannotStoreEntries
Data.Value: The selected group cannot store any entries.

Data.Name: HelpSourceNoLocalOption
Data.Value: This option is disabled, because local help is not installed.

Data.Name: HelpSourceSelectionDesc
Data.Value: Choose between local help and online help center.

Data.Name: HideCloseDatabaseTb
Data.Value: Hide 'Close Database' toolbar button when at most one database is open

Data.Name: HotKeyAltOnly
Data.Value: It is recommended not to use global hot keys with only Alt or Alt+Shift as modifier.

Data.Name: HotKeyAltOnlyHint
Data.Value: Recommended modifiers are Ctrl+Alt, Ctrl+Shift and Ctrl+Alt+Shift.

Data.Name: HotKeyAltOnlyQuestion
Data.Value: Are you sure you want to use the specified hot keys?

Data.Name: ImageFormatFeatureUnsupported
Data.Value: This file uses a file format feature that is not supported.

Data.Name: ImportMustRead
Data.Value: It is indispensable that you read the documentation about this import method before continuing.

Data.Name: ImportMustReadQuestion
Data.Value: Have you understood how the import process works and want to start it now?

Data.Name: InvalidUserPassword
Data.Value: The specified user name / password combination is invalid.

Data.Name: KdbKeePassLibC
Data.Value: The KeePassLibC library is required to open and save KDB files created by KeePass 1.x.

Data.Name: KdbWUA
Data.Value: KDB files can be encrypted using a master password and/or a key file, not using a Windows User Account.

Data.Name: KdfAdjust
Data.Value: The value of a key derivation function parameter lies outside the range of valid values. KeePass adjusts the value to the nearest valid value.

Data.Name: KdfParams1Sec
Data.Value: Compute parameters that lead to a delay of 1 second on this computer.

Data.Name: KeePassLibCNotWindows
Data.Value: Importing/exporting data from/to KDB files is only supported on Windows (because a library is used that contains the core code of KeePass 1.x, which is Windows-only).

Data.Name: KeePassLibCNotWindowsHint
Data.Value: Please use a different file format for migrating your data.

Data.Name: KeyFileError
Data.Value: The specified key file could not be found or its format is unknown.

Data.Name: KeyFileFromBackup
Data.Value: There are two ways to recreate a key file from this backup

Data.Name: KeyFileFromBackupF2
Data.Value: Start KeePass, click on 'Tools' -> 'Advanced Tools' -> 'Recreate Key File From Printed Backup', and fill out the form that is displayed on the screen.

Data.Name: KeyFileFromBackupT
Data.Value: Alternatively, start a text editor (e.g. Notepad), type the content above, and save it to a new file (with file extension 'keyx').

Data.Name: KeyFileGenHint
Data.Value: You can generate an XML key file in the master key creation dialog.

Data.Name: KeyFileNoXml
Data.Value: The file is not an XML key file.

Data.Name: KeyFilePrintAlso
Data.Value: Also print a key file backup

Data.Name: KeyFilePrintLocal
Data.Value: For security reasons, it is recommended to print a key file backup on a local printer, not over a network.

Data.Name: KeyFilePrintReqXml
Data.Value: Printing a key file backup is supported only for XML key files.

Data.Name: KeyFileUseAnywayQ
Data.Value: Do you want to use the file as key file anyway?

Data.Name: KeyProvExclusive
Data.Value: The selected key provider disallows combining it with any other master key component.

Data.Name: KeyProvIncmpWithSD
Data.Value: The selected key provider cannot be used, because it is incompatible with the secure desktop.

Data.Name: KeyProvIncmpWithSDHint
Data.Value: If you want to use the selected key provider, you have to disable the secure desktop option in 'Tools' -> 'Options' -> tab 'Security'.

Data.Name: LanguageSelected
Data.Value: The selected language has been activated. KeePass must be restarted in order to load the language.

Data.Name: LargeEntriesList
Data.Value: List of entries that require a lot of memory.

Data.Name: LastModifiedEntriesList
Data.Value: List of entries that have been modified recently.

Data.Name: LastModTimePwHist
Data.Value: Last Password Modification Time (Based on History)

Data.Name: LatestVersionWeb
Data.Value: The latest KeePass version can be found on the KeePass website

Data.Name: Lng1xSel
Data.Value: The selected LNG language file is compatible with KeePass 1.x only. KeePass 2.x uses LNGX language files.

Data.Name: Lng2xWeb
Data.Value: LNGX language files for KeePass 2.x are available on the KeePass website.

Data.Name: LngInAppDir
Data.Value: One or more language files have been found in the KeePass application directory.

Data.Name: LngInAppDirNote
Data.Value: Loading language files directly from the application directory is not supported. Language files should instead be stored in the 'Languages' folder of the application directory.

Data.Name: LngInAppDirQ
Data.Value: Do you want to open the application directory (in order to move or delete language files)?

Data.Name: LockOnMinimizeTaskbar
Data.Value: Lock workspace when minimizing main window to taskbar

Data.Name: LockOnMinimizeTray
Data.Value: Lock workspace when minimizing main window to tray

Data.Name: LockOnRemoteControlChange
Data.Value: Lock workspace when the remote control mode changes

Data.Name: LockOnSessionSwitch
Data.Value: Lock workspace when locking the computer or switching the user

Data.Name: LockOnSuspend
Data.Value: Lock workspace when the computer is about to be suspended

Data.Name: MasterKeyChanged
Data.Value: The master key has been changed!

Data.Name: MasterKeyChangedSave
Data.Value: In order to apply the new master key, the database must be saved.

Data.Name: MasterKeyChangeForce
Data.Value: The master key for this database has been used for quite a while and must be changed now.

Data.Name: MasterKeyChangeInfo
Data.Value: Click [OK] to open the master key changing dialog.

Data.Name: MasterKeyChangeQ
Data.Value: Do you want to change the master key now?

Data.Name: MasterKeyChangeRec
Data.Value: The master key for this database has been used for quite a while and it is recommended to change it now.

Data.Name: MasterKeyComponents
Data.Value: The master key for this database file consists of the following components:

Data.Value: Enter master key on secure desktop

Data.Name: MasterPasswordConfirm

Data.Name: MasterPasswordMinLengthFailed

Data.Name: MasterPasswordMinQualityFailed

Data.Name: MasterPasswordRmbWhileOpen
Data.Value: Remember master password (in encrypted form) of a database while it is open

Data.Name: MasterPasswordWeak
Data.Value: The specified master password is weak.

Data.Name: MaxAttachmentSize
Data.Value: The maximum supported attachment size is {PARAM}.

Data.Name: MinimizeAfterAutoType
Data.Value: Minimize main window after performing auto-type

Data.Name: MinimizeAfterCopy
Data.Value: Minimize main window after copying data to the clipboard

Data.Name: MinimizeAfterLocking
Data.Value: Minimize main window after locking the workspace

Data.Name: MinimizeAfterOpeningDatabase

Data.Name: MinimizeToTray
Data.Value: Minimize to tray instead of taskbar

Data.Name: NativeLibUse

Data.Name: NoEncNoCompress
Data.Value: Make sure that it is not encrypted and not compressed.

Data.Name: NoXslFile
Data.Value: The selected file isn't a valid XSL stylesheet.

Data.Name: OptimizeForScreenReader
Data.Value: Optimize for screen reader (activate only if you are using a screen reader)

Data.Name: OptionReqOn
Data.Value: For this operation, the following option must be turned on:

Data.Value: Here you can configure the global KeePass program options.

Data.Name: OtpGenSettingsDesc
Data.Value: One-time password (OTP) gen. settings for the entry.

Data.Name: OtpUsage
Data.Value: One-time passwords can be generated using the commands in the main window or using the {PARAM} placeholder.

Data.Name: PackageInstallHint
Data.Value: Install this package and try again.

Data.Name: ParamDescHelp
Data.Value: Detailed descriptions of all parameters can be found in the help manual.

Data.Name: PasswordOptionsDesc
Data.Value: Here you can define properties of generated passwords.

Data.Name: PasswordQualityReport2
Data.Value: Estimated quality of the entry passwords (excluding TANs).

Data.Name: PasswordRepeatFailed
Data.Value: Password and repeated password aren't identical!

Data.Name: PasswordRepeatHint
Data.Value: Repeat the password to prevent typing errors.

Data.Name: PickFieldDesc
Data.Value: Choose a field whose value will be inserted.

Data.Name: Plugin1x
Data.Value: This plugin appears to be a plugin for KeePass 1.x.

Data.Name: Plugin1xHint
Data.Value: KeePass 1.x plugins cannot be used together with KeePass 2.x and vice versa.

Data.Name: PluginCacheClearInfo
Data.Value: The plugin cache will be cleared and rebuilt if necessary when KeePass is restarted.

Data.Name: PluginIncompatible
Data.Value: The following plugin is incompatible with the current KeePass version:

Data.Name: PluginMonoComplete
Data.Value: On some systems, the 'mono-complete' package may be required for plugins to work properly.

Data.Name: PluginOperatingSystemUnsupported
Data.Value: The current operating system is unsupported by the plugin.

Data.Name: PluginsDesc
Data.Value: Here you can configure all loaded KeePass plugins.

Data.Name: PluginUpdateHint
Data.Value: Have a look at the plugin's website for an appropriate version.

Data.Name: PolicyAutoTypeDesc
Data.Value: Allow auto-typing entries to other windows.

Data.Name: PolicyAutoTypeWithoutContextDesc
Data.Value: Allow auto-typing using the 'Perform Auto-Type' command (Ctrl+V).

Data.Name: PolicyChangeMasterKey
Data.Value: Allow changing the master key of a database.

Data.Name: PolicyChangeMasterKeyNoKeyDesc
Data.Value: Do not require entering current master key before changing it.

Data.Name: PolicyClipboardDesc
Data.Value: Allow copying entry information to clipboard (main window only).

Data.Name: PolicyCopyWholeEntriesDesc
Data.Value: Allow copying whole entries to clipboard.

Data.Name: PolicyDisallowed
Data.Value: This operation is disallowed by the application policy. Ask your administrator to allow this operation.

Data.Name: PolicyDragDropDesc
Data.Value: Allow sending information to other windows using drag&drop.

Data.Name: PolicyExportNoKeyDesc
Data.Value: Do not require entering current master key before exporting.

Data.Name: PolicyImportDesc
Data.Value: Allow importing entries from external files.

Data.Name: PolicyPluginsDesc
Data.Value: Allow loading plugins to extend KeePass functionality.

Data.Name: PolicyPrintNoKeyDesc
Data.Value: Do not require entering current master key before printing.

Data.Name: PolicyRequiredFlag
Data.Value: The following policy flag is required

Data.Name: ProfileSaveDesc
Data.Value: Save the current settings as a profile.

Data.Name: ProfileSavePrompt
Data.Value: Enter a name for the new profile or select an existing profile to overwrite it:

Data.Name: QualityCheckToggle
Data.Value: Enable/disable quality estimation for this entry (here, in password quality reports, ...)

Data.Name: QuickSearchDerefData
Data.Value: Resolve field references in quick searches

Data.Name: QuickSearchExclExpired
Data.Value: Exclude expired entries in quick searches

Data.Name: QuickSearchInPwFields
Data.Value: Search for passwords in quick searches

Data.Name: QuickSearchQ
Data.Value: Would you like to perform a quick search?

Data.Name: RecycleBinCollapse
Data.Value: Collapse newly-created recycle bin tree node

Data.Name: RecycleEntryConfirm
Data.Value: Are you sure you want to move the selected entries to the recycle bin?

Data.Name: RecycleEntryConfirmSingle
Data.Value: Are you sure you want to move the selected entry to the recycle bin?

Data.Name: RecycleGroupConfirm
Data.Value: Are you sure you want to move the selected group to the recycle bin?

Data.Name: RecycleMoveInfo
Data.Value: At least one of the selected entries/groups will be moved into/within the recycle bin.

Data.Name: RecycleShowConfirm
Data.Value: Show confirmation dialog when moving entries/groups to the recycle bin

Data.Name: RememberHidingPasswordsEntry
Data.Value: Remember password hiding setting in the entry editing dialog

Data.Name: RememberHidingPasswordsMain
Data.Value: Remember password hiding setting in the main window

Data.Name: RememberKeySources
Data.Value: Remember key sources (key file paths, provider names, ...)

Data.Name: RepairModeInt
Data.Value: In repair mode, the integrity of the data is not checked (in order to rescue as much data as possible). When no integrity checks are performed, corrupted/malicious data might be incorporated into the database.

Data.Name: RepairModeQ
Data.Value: Are you sure you want to attempt to repair the selected file?

Data.Name: RepairModeUse
Data.Value: Thus the repair functionality should only be used when there really is no other solution. If you use it, afterwards you should thoroughly check your whole database for corrupted/malicious data.

Data.Name: RepeatOnlyWhenHidden
Data.Value: Require password repetition only when hiding using asterisks is enabled

Data.Name: RestartKeePassQuestion
Data.Value: Do you wish to restart KeePass now?

Data.Name: SameKeybLayout
Data.Value: Ensure same keyboard layouts during auto-type

Data.Name: SaveBeforeCloseEntry
Data.Value: Do you want to save the changes you have made to this entry?

Data.Name: SaveBeforeCloseQuestion
Data.Value: Do you want to save the changes before closing?

Data.Name: SaveForceSync
Data.Value: Do not ask whether to synchronize or overwrite; force synchronization

Data.Name: SearchKeyFilesAlsoOnRemovable
Data.Value: Automatically search key files also on removable media

Data.Name: SecDeskFileDialogHint
Data.Value: Note: KeePass shows this simple file browser dialog, because standard Windows file dialogs cannot be shown on the secure desktop for security reasons.

Data.Name: SecDeskOpContinueOnNormal
Data.Value: KeePass will cancel the current dialog and switch to the normal desktop. The requested operation will then be performed on the normal desktop.

Data.Name: SecDeskOpUnsupported
Data.Value: This operation cannot be performed on the secure desktop.

Data.Name: SecDeskOtherSwitched
Data.Value: An application has switched from the secure desktop to a different desktop.

Data.Name: SecDeskPlaySound
Data.Value: Play UAC sound when switching to secure desktop

Data.Name: SecDeskSwitchBack
Data.Value: Click [OK] to switch back to the secure desktop.

Data.Name: SelectLanguageDesc
Data.Value: Here you can change the user interface language.

Data.Name: SelfTestFailed
Data.Value: One or more of the KeePass self-tests failed.

Data.Name: ShowDerefDataAndRefs
Data.Value: When showing dereferenced data, additionally show references

Data.Name: ShowFullPathInTitleBar
Data.Value: Show full path in title bar (instead of file name only)

Data.Name: SimilarPasswordsList2
Data.Value: List of entries that are using similar passwords (excluding TANs).

Data.Name: SimilarPasswordsNoDup
Data.Value: The list shows entries that are using similar, but not identical passwords. For finding entries that are using the same passwords, use the 'Duplicate Passwords' command (in the main menu).

Data.Name: SoonToExpireEntries
Data.Value: Expired Entries and Entries That Will Expire Soon

Data.Name: StandardExpireSelect
Data.Value: Select one of the standard expiry times

Data.Name: SynchronizeStc
Data.Value: Synchronize active database with a file/URL

Data.Name: SynchronizingHint
Data.Value: Make sure that the two databases use the same master key. This is required for a synchronization.

Data.Name: TanExpiresOnUse
Data.Value: Mark TAN entries as expired when using them

Data.Name: TanWizardDesc
Data.Value: With this TAN wizard you can easily add TAN entries.

Data.Name: TooManyFilesError
Data.Value: Too many files have been selected. Select smaller groups and repeat the current procedure a few times.

Data.Name: TrayIconSingleClick
Data.Value: Single click instead of double click for default tray icon action

Data.Name: TreeViewShowLines
Data.Value: Show lines between nodes in tree views

Data.Name: TriggerActionTypeUnknown
Data.Value: The trigger action type is unknown.

Data.Name: TriggerConditionTypeUnknown
Data.Value: The trigger condition type is unknown.

Data.Name: TriggerEventTypeUnknown
Data.Value: The trigger event type is unknown.

Data.Name: TriggersDesc
Data.Value: Automate workflows using the trigger system.

Data.Name: TypeUnknownHint
Data.Value: A newer KeePass version or a plugin might be required for this type.

Data.Name: UnhideSourceCharactersToo
Data.Value: Unhide button also unhides source characters

Data.Name: UpdateCheckFailedNoDl
Data.Value: Update check failed. Version information file cannot be downloaded.

Data.Name: UpdateCheckInfo
Data.Value: KeePass can automatically check for updates on each program start.

Data.Name: UpdateCheckInfoPriv
Data.Value: No personal information is sent to the KeePass web server. KeePass just downloads a small version information file and compares the available version with the installed version.

Data.Name: UpdateCheckInfoRes
Data.Value: Automatic update checks are performed unintrusively in the background. A notification is only displayed when an update is available. Updates are not downloaded or installed automatically.

Data.Name: UpdateCheckResults
Data.Value: The results of the update check.

Data.Name: UrlFieldEmptyFirstTab
Data.Value: The URL field (on the first tab page) is empty.

Data.Name: UrlOpenDesc
Data.Value: Open a database stored on a server.

Data.Name: UrlSaveDesc
Data.Value: Save current database on a server.

Data.Name: URtfCheck
Data.Value: It is recommended to reopen the text and check it carefully.

Data.Name: URtfProblem
Data.Value: KeePass has detected that certain characters in your text may have been corrupted (due to a bug in Windows).

Data.Name: URtfSuggestion
Data.Value: In order to avoid text corruptions, turn off the Windows option 'Use Unicode UTF-8 for worldwide language support'.

Data.Name: UseTransactedConfigWrites
Data.Value: Use file transactions for writing configuration settings

Data.Name: UseTransactedDatabaseWrites
Data.Value: Use file transactions for writing databases

Data.Name: UuidFix
Data.Value: When closing this dialog, KeePass will fix the problem (by generating new UUIDs for duplicates) and continue.

Data.Name: VerifyWrittenFileAfterSave
Data.Value: Verify written file after saving a database

Data.Name: WindowsUserAccountBackup
Data.Value: You should create a complete backup of your Windows user account.

Data.Name: XmlModInvalid
Data.Value: The modified XML data is invalid.

Data.Name: XmlReplaceDesc
Data.Value: Replace data in the XML representation of the database.

Data.Name: CharSetTooFewChars
Data.Value: There are too few characters in the character set.

Data.Name: EncDataTooLarge
Data.Value: The data is too large to be encrypted/decrypted securely using {PARAM}.

Data.Name: ErrorInClipboard
Data.Value: An extended error report has been copied to the clipboard.

Data.Name: FileIncomplete
Data.Value: Data is missing at the end of the file, i.e. the file is incomplete.

Data.Name: FileIncompleteExpc
Data.Value: Less data than expected could be read from the file.

Data.Name: FileLoadFailed
Data.Value: Failed to load the specified file!

Data.Name: FileLockedWrite
Data.Value: The file is locked, because the following user is currently writing to it:

Data.Name: FileNewVerOrPlgReq
Data.Value: A newer KeePass version or a plugin is required to open this file.

Data.Name: FileNewVerReq
Data.Value: A newer KeePass version is required to open this file.

Data.Name: FileSaveCorruptionWarning
Data.Value: The target file might be corrupted. Please try saving again. If that fails, save the database to a different location.

Data.Name: FileSaveFailed2
Data.Value: Failed to save to the specified file!

Data.Name: FileSigInvalid
Data.Value: The file signature is invalid. Either the file isn't a KeePass database file at all or it is corrupted.

Data.Name: FileUnknownCipher
Data.Value: The file is encrypted using an unknown encryption algorithm!

Data.Name: FileUnknownCompression
Data.Value: The file is compressed using an unknown compression algorithm!

Data.Name: FileVersionUnsupported
Data.Value: The file format version is unsupported.

Data.Name: FinalKeyCreationFailed
Data.Value: Failed to create the final encryption/decryption key!

Data.Name: FrameworkNotImplExcp
Data.Value: The .NET Framework/runtime under which KeePass is currently running does not support this operation.

Data.Name: InvalidCompositeKeyHint
Data.Value: Make sure that the master key is correct and try it again.

Data.Name: KeePass1xHint
Data.Value: In order to import KeePass 1.x KDB files, create a new 2.x database file and click 'File' -> 'Import' in the main menu. In the import dialog, choose 'KeePass KDB (1.x)' as file format.

Data.Name: KeyFileDbSel
Data.Value: Database files cannot be used as key files.

Data.Name: KeyHashMismatch
Data.Value: The key and the hash do not match, i.e. the key or the hash is invalid.

Data.Name: MasterSeedLengthInvalid
Data.Value: The length of the master key seed is invalid!

Data.Name: OldFormat
Data.Value: The selected file appears to be an old format

Data.Name: PathBackslash
Data.Value: The path contains a backslash. Such paths are not supported (for security reasons).

Data.Name: TryAgainSecs
Data.Value: Please try it again in a few seconds.

Data.Name: UserAccountKeyError
Data.Value: The operating system did not grant KeePass read/write access to the user profile folder, where the protected user key is stored.
